comments.body: Please double check that setup tools is needed as a runtime dependency, it is usually only needed at build time.

I actually only found it it is needed when the tests failed on the CI system. I already proposed a PR to the original project to add `setuptools` to their requirements in `setup.py`: https://github.com/mpcabd/python-arabic-reshaper/pull/27

So to answer your request: yes, I'm absolutely sure it's a runtime requirement.

I saw you added the license file to the recipe, thank you.

Would you be able to also open a PR against the original package to have the license added to the git repo to include the changes to the MANIFEST.in?
Thanks, the PR has been filed: https://github.com/mpcabd/python-arabic-reshaper/pull/26

last comment:
   - it looks like the upstream package includes unit tests, if you know how to call them please add them here. If not, just lets open a PR on the -feedstock after it is merged.

If I understand correctly, one would simply have to run `python arabic_reshaper/tests/test_001_initialization.py` and `python arabic_reshaper/tests/test_002_reshaping.py` from the source directory.

The call to `setup()` in `setup.py` contains a `test_suite` kwarg; however, the test scripts are _not_ part of the distribution, so I don't think there's a way to run those tests on the built `conda` package.
